instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> right fan spin after palm rest swap.
threads.message: I just swapped a palm rest on an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 15in macbook pro 2016. After the swap the fan on the right spins at max right when the computer is turned on. I have tried another palm rest, the original one, and a new fan it is still going full. My iphone board guy looked it over and saw what looked like a resistor labeled 2a2 that had solder balls coming out from under it. Thanks for any help!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> right fan spin after palm rest swap.
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Post the 820-xxxxx code of your board.
Locate that "resistor" in boardview and replace it, if bad.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> right fan spin after palm rest swap.
threads.message: It is board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Looking at the schematics the chip looks like <RESISTOR>R6907</RESISTOR>. Would this one cause the fan to spin high? Where can I get a chip to replace this one with?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> right fan spin after palm rest swap.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R6907</RESISTOR> is a 2.2 ohm resistor, which can be replaced just by a tiny wire; if no correct replacement available.
It is not fan related.
Machine works without <RESISTOR>R6907</RESISTOR>, but only with charger plugged in; will shutdown immediatelly when charger is disconnected.
Also will not turn on with battery alone.

Trackpad has some temp sensor.
You now have a bad trackpad board, or flex...
